title: OnePlus 13T leaks show a surprising design
description: OnePlus is launching the 13T soon, perhaps by the end of this month. As we get closer to the unveiling, more and more leaks about it are starting to pop up, and today we get our first actual look at the device - two looks, in fact. First, there's a video leak embedded below, showcasing the phone in white. excerpt: It's unclear if this is the new OnePlus design language or just a one-off, but it is different, that's for sure. OnePlus is launching the 13T soon, perhaps...
text: OnePlus is launching the 13T soon, perhaps by the end of this month. As we get closer to the unveiling, more and more leaks about it are starting to pop up, and today we get our first actual look at the device - two looks, in fact. First, there's a video leak embedded below, showcasing the phone in white. OnePlus 13T First Live Look ðŸ‘€ The Weight Balance seems really Great this time! pic.twitter.com/p5svDDxgPgâ€” TECH INFO (@TECHINFOSOCIALS) April 12, 2025 Next up, here it is in black in a leaked image: The OnePlus 13T will also be offered in a pink-ish hue, which was revealed last week. That isn't a road often traveled by the brand, and the same can be said for the design of the camera island. It definitely doesn't scream OnePlus, from a distance it actually looks most similar to what Google did for the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. There are also some traces of the Xiaomi Mi 11 in it. It's definitely interesting to see OnePlus switch things up design-wise, but at this point we're not sure if this is the new design language that we should expect from its future devices, or just a one-off for the upcoming smaller flagship. The OnePlus 13T has a 6.31-inch LTPO OLED screen with "1.5K" resolution and 120 Hz refresh rate, the Snapdragon 8 Elite at the helm, a 50 MP main camera, a 50 MP telephoto with 2x optical zoom, a 6,200 mAh battery with 80W wired charging support, and it will be the first OnePlus phone to ditch the Alert Slider for a programmable button, according to past rumors.
html:
OnePlus is launching the 13T soon, perhaps by the end of this month. As we get closer to the unveiling, more and more leaks about it are starting to pop up, and today we get our first actual look at the device - two looks, in fact.

First, there's a video leak embedded below, showcasing the phone in white.

OnePlus 13T First Live Look ðŸ‘€
The Weight Balance seems really Great this time! pic.twitter.com/p5svDDxgPg

â€” TECH INFO (@TECHINFOSOCIALS) April 12, 2025

Next up, here it is in black in a leaked image:

The OnePlus 13T will also be offered in a pink-ish hue, which was revealed last week. That isn't a road often traveled by the brand, and the same can be said for the design of the camera island. It definitely doesn't scream OnePlus, from a distance it actually looks most similar to what Google did for the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. There are also some traces of the Xiaomi Mi 11 in it.

It's definitely interesting to see OnePlus switch things up design-wise, but at this point we're not sure if this is the new design language that we should expect from its future devices, or just a one-off for the upcoming smaller flagship.

The OnePlus 13T has a 6.31-inch LTPO OLED screen with "1.5K" resolution and 120 Hz refresh rate, the Snapdragon 8 Elite at the helm, a 50 MP main camera, a 50 MP telephoto with 2x optical zoom, a 6,200 mAh battery with 80W wired charging support, and it will be the first OnePlus phone to ditch the Alert Slider for a programmable button, according to past rumors.
